meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's that time of year again when I get to play and review another LEGO Marvel Super Heroes game. Yay!

Before we dive in, let me just say that I'm not a Marvel super fanboy (okay, maybe a little), but I do love me some LEGO games! There's something so satisfying about smashing blocks with my favorite superheroes.

So, what's the verdict on LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2? Well, it seems like most critics agree that this game is more of the same, and that's not a bad thing! The variety of settings, heroes, and abilities keeps things fresh and fun to play, especially in co-op.

IGN gave it an 80, praising its constant entertainment value. GameSpot chimed in with a 70, saying it's still a winner, even if the formula is starting to get a little stale. Gaming Age also gave it high marks, calling it better than the previous Marvel LEGO game (LEGO Avengers).

Meanwhile, other critics were less enthusiastic. Destructoid gave it a 70, saying that while it's still entertaining, its core mechanics are stuck in the past. Vandal awarded it a 77, stating that you won't find many new features, but the universe and formula are both quite good.

Me? I think I'll just stick with my Hippo Penny- approved score: WOOHOO!

In all seriousness, LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a great addition to the series. If you're a fan of LEGO games or Marvel, you'll have a blast playing through this one. And who knows, you might even learn something about the Marvel universe along the way!
